result.execSummary:
The defendant Romelo D Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time, verifiable employment or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs which is to include cognitive therapy.  Follow through with recommendations.   No contact with co-defendant.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber for school and 2 consecutive hours daily for care of mother.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Any unpaid court costs and fees ordered at sentencing, June 12, 2015 remain due and owing.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Provide DNA sample, if not previously provided, and pay $250 surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Have no association with known gang members.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

***PLUS $4000 SIGNATURE BOND***
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Exceptions are court and attorney appointments.  Defendant is to have no visitors in the home.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 03-31-2015: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE 3 HOURS PER WEEK, IN ONE LUMP SUM, TO GO TO RACINE PUBLIC LIBRARY AND IF DEFENDANT GETS AN INTERVIEW HE MAY ATTEND INTERVIEW. DEFENDANT MUST NOTIFY ZCI PRIOR TO LEAVING HIS HOME
Sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Romelo D Harris in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt of same and waives reading. NG plea is entered.
Upon plea to amended charge. The State recommends prison but ss as to amount but specifically asks that as a condition of ES, no gang involvement, no weapons, no contact with co-deft, FT emp/school, any counseling deemed approp by agent.

finding of guilt

Defense is asking that GPS be removed to allow defendant to obtain employment and to attend Gateway to continue his education. The State objects. Due to the nature of the offense and that the presumption of innocence is gone the State believes GPS is appropriate.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered.  GPS is to remain. Defendant may have 3 hours per week, in one lump sum, to go to Racine Public Library and if defendant gets an interview he may attend interview. He must notify ZCI prior to leaving the home.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
